sections.title: Annotation
sections.subtitle: Create, manage, and review annotations for images and video with clear QA flows and exportable formats.

items.name: LabelMe
items.summary: Lightweight desktop tool for drawing polygons, boxes, and points on images. Ideal for small to medium projects that need speed and local control without deploying a server.
details: Saves to readable JSON; easy to script conversions to COCO/Pascal.
Convenient for quick pilots, labeling policies prototyping, and classroom use.
Runs locally; no network dependency or user management overhead.

items.name: CVAT
items.summary: Browser-based platform for image and video annotation with task queues, review workflow, and assisted labeling. Good fit for team projects and longer-running efforts.
details: Supports tracking, interpolation, and semi-automatic annotation for videos.
Role-based permissions and review/accept cycles for quality control.
Exports to common CV formats; integrates with on-prem or cloud storage.

items.name: Label Studio
items.summary: Configurable web tool for multi-modal labeling. Useful when tasks evolve over time and you need custom templates or active-learning hooks.
details: Custom labeling configs; SDK and webhooks for automation.
Supports annotation review and simple agreement checks.

sections.title: Versioning & Experiments
sections.subtitle: Track code, data, and results so experiments are repeatable and comparable across contributors.

items.name: GitHub
items.summary: Source control and collaboration with pull requests, issues, and project boards. The backbone for code reviews and open development in the community.
details: Use Actions for continuous integration (CI) to run tests, lint, and build docs on every commit.
Discussions for proposals and governance; Projects for kanban tracking.
Publish documentation with GitHub Pages or MkDocs workflows.

items.name: Git LFS
items.summary: Store large files (images, labels, binaries) alongside your repository using pointer files so the repo stays lightweight for developers.
details: Works with most major git forges; keeps clones small and fast.
Combine with Data Version Control (DVC) for dataset pipelines and cache management.

items.name: DVC
items.summary: Version datasets and pipelines just like code. Capture parameters, metrics, and artifacts to make experiments auditable end-to-end.
details: Backends: S3/GCS/Azure/SSH; lightweight metafiles live in git.
Plots and metrics comparison for runs; integrates with CI.
Pairs well with MLflow for run tracking.

items.name: MLflow
items.summary: Track runs, parameters, metrics, and artifacts. Add an optional model registry for promoting versions to staging/production.
details: Web UI for comparing runs; log images, predictions, and notebooks.
Python APIs and CLI; storage can be file system or object store.
Complements DVC pipelines and GitHub Actions CI.

sections.title: Open Repositories
sections.subtitle: Share datasets, models, and code snapshots with persistent identifiers so others can cite and reuse your work.

items.name: Hugging Face Hub
items.summary: Open hub for datasets and models with simple git-style versioning and model cards. Great for discoverability and quick demos via Spaces.
details: Dataset viewers and diffing; automated README rendering.
Permissions and organizations for collaboration.
Good complement to a DOI-issuing archive (e.g., Zenodo).

items.name: Zenodo
items.summary: Research archive that mints DOIs for datasets and software. Ensures long-term citation and preservation of the exact version used in a study.
details: Versioned records; metadata for authors, affiliations, and grants.
Connect a GitHub repo to archive releases automatically.
Embargo options and community collections.

items.name: Figshare
items.summary: Citable repository for research artifacts with DOIs and rich previews. Useful when you need controlled access or institutional hosting.
details: Built-in previews for many file types and large files.
Metadata export and analytics for downloads/views.

items.name: OSF
items.summary: Project-centric hub for components, registrations, and team permissions. Good for organizing multi-artifact studies end-to-end.
details: Preregistration workflows; component structure and contributors.
Storage integrations; transparent version history.

sections.title: 3D / GIS / Web
sections.subtitle: Turn imagery into 3D, process point clouds and rasters, and publish interactive web visualizations.

items.name: CloudCompare
items.summary: Interactive desktop app for point-cloud editing, registration (ICP), and distance calculations. Well-suited to QC, manual clean-ups, and measurements.
details: Segment/merge clouds and meshes; compute statistics and deviations.
Export subsets for training/validation splits or manual reports.

items.name: Open3D
items.summary: Modern 3D library in Python/C++ for meshing, registration, reconstruction, and visualization. Good foundation for custom pipelines and research.
details: Geometry ops, voxel grids, TSDF, RGB-D integration; Jupyter widgets.
Works with NumPy/PyTorch; headless rendering for batch jobs.

items.name: PDAL
items.summary: Command-line and JSON pipeline framework for reading, filtering, transforming, and writing point clouds at scale.
details: Support for LAS/LAZ/E57; reprojection; ground filtering; decimation.
Composable stages; easy to integrate in CI and reproducible pipelines.

items.name: OpenDroneMap
items.summary: From drone imagery to dense point clouds, orthomosaics, and DEM/DSM. Useful for site documentation, progress tracking, and mapping.
details: Docker images and NodeODM for distributed processing.
Orthos and 3D outputs can feed Potree/CesiumJS viewers.

items.name: GDAL
items.summary: Translator library for raster and vector geospatial data formats, essential for geospatial pipelines.
details: CLI tools and programmatic APIs.
Build pyramids/overviews; convert heavy rasters to web-friendly Cloud Optimized GeoTIFFs (COGs).

items.name: QGIS
items.summary: Desktop GIS for styling, analysis, and map production with a rich plugin ecosystem. Great for exploratory analysis and cartography.
details: Processing toolbox wraps many geospatial algorithms.
Print composer and atlas for professional map outputs.

items.name: CesiumJS
items.summary: Web-native 3D globe for tiling and streaming large city/terrain datasets. Ideal for publishing interactive site or corridor visualizations.
details: 3D Tiles, terrain, imagery layers; timeline and camera controls.
Works with photogrammetry outputs and building models.

items.name: kepler.gl
items.summary: No-code geospatial analytics in the browser for trajectories, heatmaps, and time-aware layers. Rapidly explore CSV/GeoJSON without custom code.
details: Time sliders, filters, deck.gl rendering; export sharable configs.
Good companion for quick data sanity checks and presentations.

items.name: Potree
items.summary: Web viewer optimized for very large point clouds with measurement tools and level-of-detail rendering.
details: Convert with PotreeConverter; host static files on any web server.
Annotate viewpoints and share interactive inspections with teams.
